Danish[edit]

Noun[edit]

German[edit]

Verb[edit]

bringen (irregular, third-person singular simple present bringt, past tense brachte, past participle gebracht, past subjunctive brÃ¤chte, auxiliary haben)

  1. (transitive) to bring; to fetch
  2. (transitive) to take; to convey
  3. (transitive) to lead; to cause; to bear
  4. (transitive, with â€œan sichâ€) to acquire; to take possession of

Low German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • brÃ¤ngen

Etymology[edit]

From Middle Low German bringen, brengen, from Old Saxon brengian, bringan, from Proto-Germanic *bringanÄ…, from Proto-Indo-European *bÊ°renk-. Compare Dutch brengen, German bringen, English bring, West Frisian bringe.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ËˆbrÉªÅ‹É™n/, /ËˆbrÉªË‘Å‹Å‹Ì©/

Verb[edit]

bringen (third-person singular simple present bringt, past tense broch, past participle brocht, auxiliary verb hebben)

  1. To bring, carry, deliver, supply
